summary: This is a scheduling order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It sets deadlines for pretrial disclosures, motions, and other procedures, with a provisional trial commencement date of July 12, 2021. The order references the S2 indictment and agreements between the parties.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this scheduling order is issued. The order addresses her request for a continuance and sets deadlines for her defense team's pretrial activities.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this scheduling order, setting deadlines for pretrial procedures and considering the defendant's request for a continuance.

events.title: Court Conference
events.description: A conference was held where the court considered the defendant's request for a continuance of the trial.

events.title: Provisional Trial Commencement Date
events.description: The court provisionally set July 12, 2021, as the trial commencement date, pending resolution of the defendant's request for a continuance.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court issued a detailed pretrial schedule for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, with a provisional trial start date of July 12, 2021.
The schedule includes deadlines for expert witness disclosures, supplemental motions related to the new S2 indictment charges, and disclosure of alleged victims referenced in the S2 indictment.
The order references the defendant's request for a continuance, which the court was still considering at the time of the order.
The parties were ordered to confer and submit a joint letter regarding the government's proposal for advance submission of witness statements under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 26.2.
